INGREDIENTS:


•White pumpkin (ash gourd) - 2 cups
 •(peel the skin, remove the seeds and chop it into cubes) 
 •Tur dal -1/4 cup
 •Tamarind - small gooseberry sized ball
 •Brown or white channa (garbanzo) - handful (Optional) (traditionally we use brown channa) 
 •Turmeric powder - a pinch
 •Salt as required


Roast and grind: 

•Bengal gram/kadalai paruppu - 1 tbsp
 •Coriander seeds/ malli -1 tbsp
 •Red chilli -3
 •Raw rice - 1 tsp
 •Grated Coconut - 2 tbsp


Roast the above ingredients in a little oil adding grated coconut in the end.Grind it to a smooth paste adding little water. Keep it aside. 


For the seasoning : 

•Oil -1 tsp
 •Mustard -1 tsp
 •Hing - a pinch
 •Curry leaves - little


PREPARATION: 

1.Wash, peel the skin and chop pumpkin into cubes. Cook it in a little water till soft. 

2.Soak tamarind in 1/2 cup of water and extract its juice. Throw the pulp. 
 3.Pressure cook tur dal with a pinch of turmeric powder. 

4.If using dried channa, soak it overnight and pressure cook with a little salt and keep it aside. 

(I usually keep channa in a small cup/vessel along with tur dal and pressure cook to save time.) 


METHOD: 

1.Heat oil, add mustard seeds, hing, curry leaves, when mustard splutters, add the cooked pumpkin pieces. 

2.Add tamarind water, salt and a pinch of turmeric powder. 

3.Boil for sometime till the raw smell of the tamarind goes, then add the grounded paste, tur dal and cooked channa. 

4.Simmer and cook for a few more minutes.Check for salt. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or chapati.
